meanings.definition: The fibrous residue left after sugarcane or similar plants have been crushed for their juice.
meanings.sent1: The bagass from the sugarcane was used to make paper.
meanings.sent2: Farmers collect bagass to use as fuel for cooking.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkeys played in the pile of bagass, pretending it was a castle.
meanings.sent4: The bagass of memories clung to her mind, reminding her of days gone by.
meanings.sent5: The bagass piled up like a fluffy cloud, waiting to be repurposed.

meanings.definition: A coarse, rough fabric made from bagass fibers.
meanings.sent1: She wore a bagass dress to the rustic-themed party.
meanings.sent2: The bagass fabric was durable and perfect for work clothes.
meanings.sent3: The bagass material scratched his skin, making him itch all day.
meanings.sent4: Her bagass shawl wrapped around her like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The bagass texture felt like a hug from nature itself.

meanings.sent1: They bagassed the leftover fibers to create eco-friendly packaging.
meanings.sent2: The artisans bagass the plant material to craft beautiful baskets.
meanings.sent3: He bagasses the raw material with precision and care.
meanings.sent4: She bagasses the fabric scraps into unique artworks.
meanings.sent5: The chef bagasses the ingredients into a delicious dish.
